pensamentos.conteudo: The mind is like a muscle. And if you want to be really powerful you have to work it out. Each new fact brings you another choice. Each new idea build another muscle. And those muscles are going to make you really strong, those are your weapons
Death is not the greatest loss The greatest loss is what dies inside us while we're still alive
It's the the stories that we say Like someone waiting to be told The act and compasses the place We watch the seats we live unfold
If you go out you come back And you come back to an empty house And now it's loneliness again It feels as though you've been dumped in the deep end And there's nobody there to rescue you
Life is a waterfall And what comes down goes around And never did we realize  That's the way we are I'm thinking about the good not the bad And never did we realize
Country roads, take me home To the place I belong West Virginia, mountain momma Take me home, country roads

And I turned 21 in prison, doing life without parole No one could steer me right but mama tried, mama tried Mama tried to raise me better but her pleading, I denied That leaves only me to blame 'cause mama tried
Se ainda não consegui é porque não tentei o suficiente.

It goes wrong, you hold on 'Cause that's what you know A fresh start with two hearts No beating alone  Emotions change, you look away Pretending they don't A goodbye, a nice No left through the lows  Come back down, it's calling One more shout, I'm falling down Take my hand, I'm all in What you say, no
